intro: Piper cajambrense, commonly known as the Chocó pepper, is a tropical vine native to the rainforests of northern South America. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes many pepper species. The plant produces small, dark red berries that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Its leaves are often used in local remedies for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
